intro: Ruellia rauhii, commonly known as the Rauh's ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees. Ruellia rauhii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long blooming period.
